thread.title: Malaysian experts head to Paris after discovery of wing part
thread.title_full: Malaysian experts head to Paris after discovery of wing part

title: Malaysian experts head to Paris after discovery of wing part
text:
Save 
Malaysian experts have met with French officials to discuss investigations into missing flight MH370, following the discovery of suspected debris. 
Part of a wing from a Boeing 777 washed up on the French-owned Reunion island in the Indian Ocean last week, and has been flown to France for tests. 
Malaysia’s transport minister said the part belonged to the same model as the Malaysia Airlines plane that vanished in March 2014. 
Tests are also set to be carried out on new debris found on Reunion, including a suitcase that was found near the wing part. 
Investigators in Toulouse are seeking to establish whether the plane part came from MH370, which disappeared from radar last March while travelling from Kuala Lumpur to Beijing, with 239 people onboard. 
Malaysia’s director of civil aviation, Azharuddin Abdul Rahman, representatives of the airline and Malaysia’s judiciary, met a magistrate in Paris to decide on the direction the investigation will take, the BBC reported. 
Neither side commented after the meeting although a statement is due.
